    All Classes and Interfaces

    Classes
    Class
    Description
    AddButtonListener
    Represents the backbone of the ADD button which is responsible for putting employee input onto the current order window based on what is selected
    CurrentOrderButtonListener
    Represents a button for each item in the current order so that these items can be viewed and removed
    DrinksButtonListener
    Represents the backbone of the drinks buttons that allows them to be pressed and visually show how many times they have been pressed
    Employee
    Represents an employee with time tracking capabilities.
    EmployeePopUp
    EmployeePopUp class extends JDialog to manage employee details and actions.
    EmployeesPage
    Represents the Employees page of the application.
    EntreeButtonListener
    Represents the backbone of the entrees buttons that allows them to be pressed and visually show how many times they have been pressed
    ExtrasButtonListener
    Represents the backbone of the extras buttons that allows them to be pressed and visually show how many times they have been pressed
    FamilyButtonListener
    Represents the backbone of the family button that allows it to be pressed and visually show how many times it has been pressed
    GUI
    Represents the MAIN GUI class that is responsible for running all tabs and delegating responsiblities to the children classes
    InventoryItem
    Represents an item in the inventory system.
    InventoryManager
    Manages all of the unit conversions associated with updating the inventory based on what ingredients were used in a completed order.
    InventoryPage
    Represents the Inventory page of the application.
    KidButtonListener
    Represents the backbone of the kid button that allows it to be pressed and visually show how many times it has been pressed
    Login
    Handles the login functionality for the application.
    MenuItem
    Represents a menu item in the restaurant management system.
    MenuPage
    Represents the Menu page of the application.
    Order
    Class to store an extensive list of order details for formatting and math
    OrderButtonListener
    Listens for when the order button has been pressed to initialize the order window and display the content of the current order to the user
    OrderDetails
    Stores the current order details and keeps track of all values to be displayed to the user.
    OrderHistory
    OrderHistory class for displaying sales history graph.
    PayButtonListener
    Takes action when the pay button is pressed to correctly update the order details, history, and inventory SQL tables
    SideButtonListener
    Represents the backbone of the sides buttons that allows them to be pressed and visually show how many times they have been pressed
    Total
    The Total class is responsible for calculating the total price of an order.
    X_report
    X_report class for generating total sales reports since the last Z-Report.
    Z_Report
    Z_Report class for generating sales reports since the last Z-Report was run.
